409.text: And I didn't even know I had it.

It's very much --
Alex talked about programming

415.text:

424.text: that people who don't fit into the binary,

431.text:
or who were born as a sex

that those people are different,

444.text:
I have been married to this person

472.text: or shame, that we were now different.

on "What does it mean to be married

What does that mean about my sexuality?

people see us and they just think

What does it mean --
you know, we go to the gym,

503.text:
and we go to the locker room together,

507.text:
and all these things lead us

511.text:
that could or could not

516.text:
And that was hard for me,
it was hard for me to go

520.text:
as a white, middle-class female,

527.text:
who is married to a male,
so I was in a heterosexual relationship,

533.text:
and I had all this privilege

538.text: So, as we're going through this journey,

541.text:
it's like we're learning
new things everyday,

544.text:
and I'm learning what words to say,
what words not to say;

547.text:
I'm learning what works in the bedroom,
what doesn't work in the bedroom, right?

552.text:
I'm relearning all sorts of things,
but what I'm learning the most

556.text:
is that a lot of my fear
about my spouse changing

562.text: was really imposed from the outside,

565.text:
it was really my fear

569.text: And so now, I stand here today.

570.text:
I am the proud wife
of a transgender woman,

574.text: and she is still my soul mate.

576.text:
And I would know she is my soul mate
if this room was dark right now,

580.text: I would know how to find her in this room.

584.text:
And I think that's the lesson
to take from all this

587.text:
is that people have a patina,
they have a presence in the world,

592.text: they have a look, or they have a job,

595.text:
or they have all these things
that are outward-facing,

598.text:
that everybody identifies them by
and puts them into boxes;

601.text:
that's how we categorize people
when we get to know them.

606.text:
and that soul is
so much deeper and stronger,

610.text:
and so much more identifiable

615.text: So, my challenge to you today is,

618.text:
"Do you know, would you even know
how to recognize your soul mate?"

625.text:
If you are going out
in the world right now,

627.text: would you know what you are looking for?

633.text: Thank you very much, it's been a pleasure.
